bio:
Bi Jinghong is a Instructor of Chinese Language at NYU Shanghai. She holds a master’s degree in Linguistics and Applied Linguistics from East China Normal University.

Bi previously worked for the University of Virginia’s 2011 Summer Program. She taught international students Chinese at East China Normal University and also interned at New York University Shanghai Center for two years. She taught Chinese at Washington and Lee University in the US from 2012-2013.

Research Interests

  • Chinese phonetics
  • Second language teaching pedagogy

Courses Taught

  • Elementary Chinese I
  • Elementary Chinese I - FoS1
  • Elementary Chinese I - FoS2
  • Elementary Chinese II
  • Intermediate Chinese I
  • Practical Chinese and Introduction to China

Education

  • MA, Linguistics and Applied Linguistics 
    East China Normal University, 2014
  • BA, Teaching Chinese as a Second Language
    Qufu Normal University, 2010
